title: Topic 001 Question 128
body: You want to migrate an on-premises mission-critical PostgreSQL database to Cloud SQL. The database must be able to withstand a zonal failure with less than five minutes of downtime and still not lose any transactions. You want to follow Google-recommended practices for the migration. What should you do?
options: Take nightly snapshots of the primary database instance, and restore them in a secondary zone.
Build a change data capture (CDC) pipeline to read transactions from the primary instance, and replicate them to a secondary instance.
Create a read replica in another region, and promote the read replica if a failure occurs.
Enable high availability (HA) for the database to make it regional.
